On 1/13/12, Sandy <magicqua=
rtz@...> wrote:
> A while back I posted my famous chicken soup recipe=
.
> Well, as luck would have it I have again, created a rather delectable d=
ish.
>
> Saut=E9ed chicken breast with Extra Virgin olive oil, sage, garlic=
, lemon
> juice and salt.
>
> 1: Coat a large skillet with extra virgin oli=
ve oil.
>
> 2: peel about a half dozen cloves of garlic, and add them to th=
e skillet.
>
> 3: Bring the heat up to medium high on the stove.  Once the =
garlic begins to
> sizzle, lower the heat one notch on the stove.  Once the=
 garlic colors
> slightly, remove it from the skillet and put aside on anot=
her plate, and
> save it for the end of the cooking process.
>
> 4: while w=
orking on the garlic in the skillet, quarter three large chicken
> breasts =
and then slice them into kabob like pieces.  Once this is done, drop
> it i=
nto the skillet and turn occasionally.
>
> 5: As the chicken cooks, prepare=
 a handful of fresh sage, and add it to the
> chicken when it begins to hav=
e a light golden color.  Also re introduce the
> garlic and add salt, and l=
emon juice.  Saut=E9 until golden brown.
>
> And then..  ENJOY.  ^^
